questions.question_text:
A technician is installing a new copy of Windows on all computers in the enterprise. Given the following requirements:

• The install phase must be scripted to run over the network.
• Each computer requires a new SSD as the system drive.
• The existing HDD should remain as a backup drive

Which of the following command-line tools should the technician use to install the drive and transfer the installation files from the network share? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABD
That is correct

To accomplish the given requirements, the technician should use the following command-line tools:

A. net use: This tool is used to connect or disconnect a computer from a shared resource, such as a network drive or printer. In this scenario, it can be used to map a network drive where the installation files are stored.

B. robocopy: This is a robust file copy tool that can efficiently copy files and directories from one location to another. It can be used to transfer the installation files from the network share to the new SSD.

D. diskpart: This command-line disk partitioning utility can be used to prepare the new SSD for the installation of Windows. It allows for partitioning, formatting, and assigning drive letters to disks.

So, the technician should use net use, robocopy, and diskpart to accomplish the installation process over the network, transfer the installation files, and prepare the new SSD, respectively.

questions.question_text: A newly hired employee is trying to enroll a personal mobile device in the company's mobile device management system. After the initial attempt, the employee receives a notification stating, "not compliant - call support.' Which of the following is the reason why the employee is receiving this message?

choices.D: The account has no profile picture.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
by process of elimination its C. like the other answer choices don't make sense in regards to the question

The reason why the employee is receiving the "not compliant - call support" message is likely because:

C. The device has been jailbroken.

Jailbreaking a mobile device involves removing the limitations imposed by the device manufacturer and carrier, allowing the user to gain privileged control over the device's operating system. However, from a security perspective, jailbroken devices pose significant risks, as they can bypass security measures implemented by the mobile device management (MDM) system. Therefore, many MDM systems are configured to detect jailbroken devices and flag them as non-compliant.

A. Group Policy

Group Policy is a Windows feature that allows administrators to manage the working environment of user accounts and computer accounts in an Active Directory environment. It provides centralized management and configuration of operating systems, applications, and user settings. By configuring Group Policy, the technician can enforce changes such as modifying the default home page of all workstations in the company.

questions.question_text: A technician is modifying the default home page of all the workstations in a company. Which of the following will help to implement this change?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Chain of custody must be maintained throughout the forensic evidence life cycle when dealing with a piece of evidence. The chain of custody refers to the chronological documentation or paper trail that records the sequence of custody, control, transfer, analysis, and disposition of physical or electronic evidence. It is crucial to maintain a clear and complete chain of custody to ensure that the evidence is admissible in court and that its integrity and authenticity are not compromised. While acceptable use, security policy, and information management are also important considerations in forensic investigations, they do not specifically refer to the maintenance of the chain of custody.
Was not expecting my time on the police force to aid in a tech based exam, but here we are

Selected Answer: B
Answer is correct

questions.question_text: Which of the following must be maintained throughout the forensic evidence life cycle when dealing with a piece of evidence?

discussion.content:
A. Automate the patching process

Automating the patching process ensures that security updates and patches are consistently and promptly applied to endpoints across the enterprise network. This helps to enhance device security by addressing vulnerabilities and reducing the risk of exploitation. Additionally, automating the patching process aligns with industry best practices for maintaining a secure and up-to-date network infrastructure.

questions.question_text: A technician is implementing the latest application security updates for endpoints on an enterprise network. Which of the following solutions should the technician use to ensure device security on the network while adhering to industry best practices?
